bibl.title: Military Orders regarding Columbia Barracks, June 5, 1900

div1.p: These endorsements regard the relationship between the laundry facilities and the spread of yellow fever at Columbia Barracks.

div1.head: Military Orders regarding Columbia Barracks, June 5, 1900
div1.p:
HEADQUARTERS
DEPARTMENT OF HAVANA
& PINAR DEL RIO.

MILITARY FILE
Recd. JUN 5 - 1990
No. 620

OFFICE CHIEF SURGEON.
HDQRS. DEPT. OF HAVANA AND PINAR
DEL RIO. QUEMADOS. CUBA.
JUNE 5TH. 1900.

Col Bks Havana, Cuba.
RECEIVED. JUN 7 - 1900
CHIEF SURGEON.

In view of the presence of yellow
fever in this community, invites
attention to what seems to be the
most probable avenues of infec-
tion of the commandat Columbia
Barracks and suggests the means
of prevention.-Laundry work &c.
1st Endorsement.

HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF HAVANA
AND PINAR DEL RIO.
Quemados, Cuba, June 6, 1900.

Respectfully referred to the
Commanding Officer, Columbia Bar-
racks, who will direct the Quar-
termaster of that post to submit
an estimate for the necessary
funds to provide proper laundry
accommodations for Columbia Bar-
racks.

By command of
BRIGADIER GENERAL LEE:

R E L Michie
✓ Adjutant General.
6/7.1900. To Post Qr. Mr
for compliance
3rd Endorsement.

Office of Post Quartermaster,
Columbia Barracks,
Quemados, Cuba,
June 19, 1900.

Respectfully returned to
the Adjutant Columbia Bar-
racks, Cuba.

The laundry building
herein referred to has been
estimated for in July Esti-
mated.

Geo. L. Giradala
Captain & A.Q.M., U.S.V
Quartermaster.
